8467bec5a51c2b24f7d97a6882fb0452 (13:56): Is there a way to make a query not use a query cache, if one is available?
8467bec5a51c2b24f7d97a6882fb0452 (13:57): I want to pull data directly from the database, and not pull anything from cache
0eb40418ab835cda37dc49b920b73981 (13:57): the query is cached not the data
8467bec5a51c2b24f7d97a6882fb0452 (14:03): Alright, so, I'm trying to get away with using benchmark() here to run through a few queries
8467bec5a51c2b24f7d97a6882fb0452 (14:03): I think I'm on the right track -  SELECT benchmark(20, SELECT SQL_NO_CACHE customers.* from customers);
8467bec5a51c2b24f7d97a6882fb0452 (14:04): However, I cannot find any examples of benchmark() off of mysql.org
8467bec5a51c2b24f7d97a6882fb0452 (14:08): Ok, so, SQL_NO_CACHE tells SQL not to cache the current query.  It doesn't say anything about previous queries.
8467bec5a51c2b24f7d97a6882fb0452 (14:08): er, using data from previous queries.
8467bec5a51c2b24f7d97a6882fb0452 (14:11): benchmark() comes back immediately.  As if it's not even running my query.
